title: Increase lesson video upload limit to 100MB

requirements.text: Increase the maximum allowed lesson video upload size to 100 MB in the frontend validation and file-reading utilities, and update all user-facing helper/validation text on the Upload Lesson page to reflect the new 100 MB limit.

quotes: Can you change the uploading video size to 100 mb

acceptanceCriteria: Selecting a valid video file up to 100 MB passes validation in validateVideoFile().
Selecting a video file larger than 100 MB is rejected with an error message that clearly states the 100 MB limit (English).
fileToUint8Array() allows reading files up to 100 MB by default (without requiring callers to pass a custom maxSizeBytes).
UploadLessonPage displays the correct max size (100MB) anywhere it currently mentions 10MB (e.g., CardDescription and helper text).

requirements.text: Increase the backend createLesson video size validation limit from 10 MB to 100 MB so that uploads accepted by the frontend are also accepted by the canister.

quotes: Can you change the uploading video size to 100 mb

acceptanceCriteria: backend/main.mo createLesson() rejects videos larger than 100 MB and accepts videos up to 100 MB.
The backend trap/error message for oversized videos states the correct 100 MB limit (English).
No state migration (backend/migration.mo) is introduced for this change.

constraints: Backend must remain a single-actor Motoko canister; keep logic in backend/main.mo.
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Implementing chunked/multipart uploads or resumable uploads.
Changing supported video formats (MP4/WebM/MOV) beyond what currently exists.
Adding new lesson metadata fields or changing lesson storage format beyond adjusting the size limit.
